result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason Antonio Turner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes:
Probation Review Hearing on 01/15/2016 at 01:30 pm.
Concurrent with:

miscConds.notes:
Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
Pay supervision fees.

No contact with firearms.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

No contact with victim until the defendant starts batterer's treatment.  Defendant may then have no violent contact.
  Defendant may have 3rd party contact for purposes of time with the child/ren.

AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens, if agent feels needed.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jason Antonio Turner in court.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  DOC agent also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.

Defendant Jason Antonio Turner in court with attorney John Thaddeus Wasielewski.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
Amended information filed charging Count 1: Misdemeanor Battery, Domestic Abuse Assessments, pursuant to Wisc. Stat. 940.19(1), 939.51(3)(a), 973.055(1), and  Count 2:  Disorderly conduct, Domestic Abuse Assessments, pursuant to Wisc. stat. 947.01(1), 939.51(3)(b), 973.055(1).  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  
.
Defendant wants to change his plea.
.
As to counts 1 and 2 in the amended information:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
.
Sentencing continued...
.
As to counts 1 and 2:
Victim has been notified.
  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 5 months in the House of Correction as to count 1 and 2 months in the House of Correction as to count 2, consecutive,  with credit for 1 day served. 
 Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 13 months, concurrent,  with the following conditions:
- Serve 20 days in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens, if agent feels needed.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim until the defendant starts batterer's treatment.  Defendant may then have no violent contact.  Defendant may have 3rd party contact for purposes of time with the child/ren.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
- Pay supervision fees.
 
Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
The next court date is in Branch 36.
Probation review hearing on 01/15/2016 at 01:30 p.m.

Defendant Jason Antonio Turner in court with attorney John Thaddeus Wasielewski.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Benjamin Lindsay.
cab
Defense counsel requests a plea and sentencing date in Branch 36.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Jason Antonio Turner in court with attorney Christina E. Balistreri.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defense counsel is still asking to withdraw.
Court grants the request.
  Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jason Antonio Turner in court with attorney Christina E. Balistreri.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Notice of motion and motion to withdraw received and filed.
Defense counsel requests to withdraw.  Defendant has failed to pay the attorney her retainer.
Defendant informed the court that he will be paying the attorney money on Monday.
The court will withhold any ruling as to the motion to withdraw until the next court date.
Case adjourned for a status date in Branch 36.
  Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Jason Antonio Turner in court with attorney William T. Berens.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requests case be set for Plea & Sentencing.   Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Victim present in court requesting modification of the No Contact orders. State opposes.  Once defendant is adjudicated as the father, court allows for telephone and electronic contact.

Defendant Jason Antonio Turner in court with attorney Christina E. Balistreri.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for a Status Conference date. Defense has not received an offer, requests and adjourned Status Conference date.   Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Status conference scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jason Antonio Turner in court with attorney Christina E. Balistreri.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant plead not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON  (5/15/15). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST. Oral No Weapons Order  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 05-28-2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Jason Antonio Turner
Current: 4715 West Wells Street #1, Milwaukee, WI 53208   (Effective: 05-14-2015)
Prior: 4715 West Wells Street #1, Milwaukee, WI 53208
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Sheron L. or her residence or place of employment
Court advised defendant he may qualify to have DNA sample expunged if the conditions are met under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 23.vb

Defendant Jason Antonio Turner in court with attorney Christina E. Balistreri.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
